lines.text: You're the Road, umm, Warrior.
Runner. I'm the Road Runner! Okay?

[quietly]
Sorry. My tears kinda messed up your add.

[the skip keeps talking and talking]
Look, theres cough medicine in the dash. Why don't you suck on that for a few miles.
Hello, Eddie.
Jack! What are you doin' here?
Oh, I just dropped off you hop-head. Where's my money?
Jack, I can't talk business now. I have this thing.
What- What thing?
This thing with this guy, it's complicated. I can't even explain.
Ah, well then I won't keep you. There you go.
[Lets Eddie leave, then stoppes him]
Hey, Jack, what are you doin'?
Eddie, do you know the differance between a bad liar and a good one?
Jack, you got no right to...
"I don't have your money because I have this thing with this guy doin' this thing...
Jack, come on, I got no time for this...
"You know, I don't have your money because I was at the Panama Canal doin' the New York Time crossword puzzel. Now, it may sound crazy but it's so specific you just have to... buy it. Did we say 800?
That's good, Eddie. Thats a very specific number. That's good.

[Jack takes Lorna dancing for fun]
This is really very sweet of you.
Shut up.
That's okay, you don't have to be nice to me, it's probably easier that way, huh? Can you at least tell me your name?
No.
Aw, come on.

[signs]
... Jack
Really? That's my dog's name!
You don't say.
You mean your not the Road Runner?

[laughs]
I'm not even Wile E. Coyote.
[Lorna slaps him]
What the hell was that for?
Who are you?
Jack. Like your dog, remember?
Are you a cop?
No!
Oh my God! You work for Michael, don't you?
Michael who?

Don't give me that, I know exactly what's going on! He sent you to bring me back and finish the job! But I'm sorry, but, you aren't going to have that opportunity because I'm perfectly capable of killing myself, thank you.
I think we both had enough fun for one night.
[Pushes Lorna off the road away from a truck]
What the hell did you do that for?
Well, I didn't want her to get hurt!
...Your paid to kill her!
Guys! What are we arguing for? Everything's fine.
[talking to Vega on the phone]
Tell him I said "good-bye."
What?

[firmly]
Tell him I said "good-bye."

[sighs]
Benny says "good-bye."
[hangs up]
You idiot.
What did he say?
Ms. Bellstratten, what makes you so sure that your niece is innocent?
Well, look at the facts. A naive young women, swept away by a man and force to commit unspeakable acts. If it wasn't real, I'd swear it was a movie.
Well, movie of the week, anyway.
Our favorite diva has finally found her prince. And do you know where this mystery man is taking her?
To the top! Whoa!
[laughs]
To the top. But, you'll never forget us, will you, Lorna?
On your way to the top, would you mind dropping off my check?
[repeated line]
Love my life!
[last lines]

Dear Jack, How does one thank someone for saving there life? Maybe if we had a proper good-bye, I would have found the words. But, I don't know. My track record with words seems to get me into trouble. I know you said we probably won't ever see one another again, but I can't help but hope that maybe someone like you could meet someone like me and maybe, somehow, make it work. I miss you, Jack. Lorna.
Ha!
[cracks open the champagne]
She was always a quite child. Never gave anyone any trouble. But, even in the crib she could carry a tune.
Well, ma'am...

[pulls out a picture of Lorna, dressed like Dorthey Gail]
Here she is in a local production of "The Wizard of Oz." She looks more like Judy Garland then Judy Garland does, don't you think?

[laughs]
Yes, ma'am, but I...
I made that costume.
Really? Well, that's very nice, but see... I... you... Can I get a, can I get a stenographer in here please?
[locked in the bathroom from the night before to hide from the hit man]

[phone rings, wakes up Jack, it's his 'wake up call']
Yeah, thanks.
[to Lorna]
Kid, it's time to hit the road. Lorna! I'm too tired to play games here.
[struggles tring to grab the hair drier]
I'm waiting.
[hits the door]
Your really pissing me off!
[breaks open the door, grabs Lorna]
What the hell is this?
I'm tring to have an accident.
You think this is a way to solve your problems, huh?
People drown in an inch of water all the time, it's a perfectly reasonable way to go.
The only place your goin' is back to Los Angeles.
How much is Michael paying you to do this?
Shut up. I don't want to hear another word outta you.
Look, would you mind if I just dragged you along side the car?
You don't believe me? Listen to "Stairway to Heaven," you know, the Zepplin tune. It was commissioned by the C.I.A to deflect attention from the conspiracy and focus on the greeving widows!
SHUT UP! Just shut up! Alright? Please...
